website_summaries.verdict: A vitamin-enriched and overall great deal for picky birdies, ZuPreem’s fruity diet of fresh and flavorful fruits is all but guaranteed to get your cockatiel or cockatoo to clean out its food bowl every day.
pros: Corn, soybean meal, and wheat are the first 3 ingredients
Features high levels of tasty oranges, apples, grapes, and bananas
cons: While cockatiels and cockatoos are going to love this sweet meal, it includes a lot of sugar

customer_reviews.title: Tricked my bird, you should trick your bird too.
customer_reviews.text: My bird is the biggest food snob on earth. She turns her nose up at apples, broccoli, other fruit, you get the idea - she'd basically only eat seed. The exception to this is if she sees me eating anything --- she NEEDS IT RIGHT NOW. This is a problem. Solution: I pretended to eat these little balls then "accidentally" left one on the table near her -- she's hooked. SUCKER! No one tell her they're healthy.
customer_reviews.author: peanut

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel liked these pellets but it was a little concerning it ...
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel liked these pellets but it was a little concerning it turned his poo red. And then shortly after eating for a few days, my cockatiel had a few episodes of vomiting. I removed these pellets and the problems resolved. Personally, id rather not have his poo be different colors due to artificial flavoring. its already hard enough to tell when birds are sick, and i wouldnt want to miss something.
customer_reviews.author: Dannij12

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in bag!
customer_reviews.text: Beware!! Bought the double pack. Noticed bugs after a few uses. Opened second bag and immediately found the larva you see in pic. I'm reporting this to zupreem. Batch number was the same for both bags. No idea what kind of flying insect this is. Hopefully my bird is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: My conure devours these daily. He mostly attacks the ...
customer_reviews.text: My conure devours these daily. He mostly attacks the banana shaped ones. Don’t know if they’re actually different flavors, or if he just likes the color and grip of it. I have to soak it in water first, he doesn’t eat them dry. I’ve tried, and he takes them to his water dish and makes a mess in there if I don’t soak them for him :( but thankfully I didn’t even have to go through the trouble I’ve been going through with my parakeet/parrotlet and pellets. He just up and ate them the first day I gave it to him. 4 months later and I still can’t get the same results for budgie/parrotlet. Ugh stubborn little birdies...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bird food
customer_reviews.text: My twenty year old green cheek absolutely goes crazy for this food. Seeds are like junk food for your bird, and I make a point to try and cut up fruit and veggies for him everyday, but sometimes life happens. This is the absolute best parrot food you can buy. Sometimes I mix seeds with it for a treat, but sometimes I don’t. He loves it regardless! Buy the cockatiel size for conures. The larger pellets are harder for them to eat even though the bag says their name on it. Trust me!
customer_reviews.author: MaryMcGlohn

customer_reviews.title: My CAG parrot Loves THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My CAG likes this smaller pellet Way Better than the parrot one. Not sure why; but She will eat the Yellow first then all the colors; leaves the green ones. Eventually I add those to blueberry oatmeal cakes & she eats them unknowingly. This smaller pellet type is the Only One after many tries other brands; that she will consistently go back to eat on a daily basis. Since She is a Rescue its hard to tell the scope of all shes been through; so keeping her eatting regularly has been a issue until we found this product in the "right" size she would~eat!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda123

customer_reviews.title: Best conure food!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two green cheek Conures and this food is the only complete nutrition pellet food that they will eat and not have any allergic reaction to! They each love different flavors too haha. One favors the bananas and the other barely touched those but loves the green pellets. They both leave most of the orange pellets behind. This bag of food is anywhere from $15-$18 per bag at the pet food stores! And only $10.50 when purchased on Amazon! Both my bags were date stamped with expirations in mid 2021. Arrived sealed in a bag together and had no package damage and the pellets were not faded in color. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: E. Earley

customer_reviews.title: Not what was advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I have four parrots that go through food Very quickly. they’ve been eating large size zupreem pellets, Since the store I was originally getting them food in bulk was no longer offering the brand I decided to get a large bag here. They advertised the same size pellets I was giving my birds. So I was expecting large pellets but when I open the bag they were actually very small. And unfortunately I got the 17 pound bag. I definitely won’t be buying again. They should have written in the description that the pellets were small and not advertise large pellets in their photos.
customer_reviews.author: Josmely Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Bird finally eating pellets!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple foods for my conure and she refused to eat any form of pellets. I saw this fruit flavored zupreem recommended in bird groups and figured I'd give it a shot. It arrived today, with an expiration date of next year. My dog even was excited at the smell of this bag and got a couple pieces lol. My bird is actually eating it. Im so shocked, but very happy! I have a GCC and ordered the medium. The picture online makes the food look bigger than it is. It really is the perfect size for these birds. I hope the pic i provided helps give you an idea of the size.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Quackers cant eat the large sized pellets,  please buy medium one for them
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large sized pellets first as it says for parrots , my parrot could barely chew it I kept seeing him dip it in water , then I bought the medium sized ones and he finally seems like hes not struggling, I have a quacker parrot and I really wished you could specify on your product that large isn't for quacker the really struggle with it......would like a refund for my previous large pellet purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ammara

customer_reviews.title: He was a pretty fussy eater (no desire to eat anything in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a cockatiel for 12 years, and his diet consisted of 95% Zupreem. He was a pretty fussy eater (no desire to eat anything in the way of fresh produce, etc.), but he definitely liked this food. As I said, he was healthy for 12 years (he finally succumbed to something unfortunate that was not diet related)- so I'm a believer. We have a new cockatiel now, and he loves his Zupreem as well. Our previous bird was so funny; he would eat the pellets one color at a time (first all the reds, then all the yellows, then the greens, etc.). Our new little guy doesn't do that. I kind of miss it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel P.

customer_reviews.title: Birds won’t eat the yellow ones, the rest are great
customer_reviews.text: Even the wild doves don’t like the yellow banana pellets. Our birds love the other ones though. Here’s a picture after the doves ate the other pellets leaving the bananas behind.
customer_reviews.author: ASF123

customer_reviews.title: excellent bird food
customer_reviews.text: I've used zupreem pellets for years. They were quickly accepted by my cockatoo, quaker, grey and cockatiels. Even when adopted from a home that fed seed, they had little problem switching. The bright colors and various shapes seem to interest birds enough to try them. One of my birds has a misshapen beak, but still has no problem biting off pieces. Well worth the money to see them enjoy their meals.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Been feeding my Senegal this for 19 yrs now!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been feeding my Senegal parrot this for 19 years now, he is doing well in it and I love it’s consistency. After all these years, have never had to return a bag and never had any bad smells or iffy issues. He likes it, and with this in addition to fresh fruits and veggies with some occasional treats, is thriving! Feathers look great, beak is healthy and his eyes are bright. I would recommend this as a great base for a healthy, well balanced diet.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Fast ship. My bird loves this food mixed with her assort. fruits n veggies
customer_reviews.text: Have had a green cheek conure for about 9 months now, got her when she was just shy of 4 months old. She was eating this brand of food when we got her and continued using it with the assortment of fruits n veggies we feed her. and she loves it. I received a free sample of some other brand of parrot food for the avion vet a month after getting her and our bird would just nibble and never really eat eat. So we stuck with what she liked and wont ever change her diet from it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product as in stores
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the price was so much better than in stores. Usually around $16.00 each. BUT.. you get what you pay for I guess. The pieces are tiny compared to the store bags and doesn't have the 'fruity' smell either. My birds LOVE the store bought bags... this stuff, not so much! I'm usually filling their dish every day. It's been 3 days and still not gone..... Very disappointed in this product. Will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My birds love this food! I have a cockatiel and a green cheek conure and this is the only kind of bird food I can find that they will both eat. They waste very little so I feel like that justifies the price. Not only is it healthier for them to eat pellets instead of seeds, it’s a lot less messy too! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Olivia  Porter

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal... Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pellet.... my bird's enjoy eating this brand of pellet's. But Each bird seems to always leave one color in there though, but eat all other color's. There preference seems to change every other month though, on what color they'll leave behind. This pellet has a fruity smell and seems pretty fresh. The package I got, had a year away expiration date. The package arrived undamaged and on time. I am pleased with this brand, and my birds are all healthy. The cost is much cheaper buying it this way, then buying at the pet store. My birds give this item a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Jones

customer_reviews.title: Healthy treat for chipmunks
customer_reviews.text: This food adds some great "treat" elements to my chipmunk and mouse diet without giving them too much inclination to seek out sweet foods to the exclusion of other healthy foods. Rodents eat like toddlers, so a reduced sugar diet balanced with fun crunchy treats to keep their teeth ground down properly is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They hate and I afraid of😔 but now changing 😊 4.5 stairs
customer_reviews.text: My 2 Pineapple concure and ringneck Indian parrot see colour food RUN RUN 😔 maybe if I order without colour , they will be try it UPDATE: 2 Pineapple conure love it if put with water, but ringneck Indian not yet Most important part: I see magic in one Pineapple conure ( have weak healthy problem ) just in 4 days when he start eat it .The physical appearance change specially in his beak and color feathers
customer_reviews.author: budoor alhulaibi

customer_reviews.title: Birdy dinner time!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product so my bird will have something healthy to eat!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not very functional
customer_reviews.text: These are such a cute idea that needs some modification. This is not an "alligator clip", but rather the type that slides onto the edge of a pocket or a thin pants waistband. It doesn't work with shirts like polos, scrubs, tees, sweaters or women's blouses because it doesn't swivel so the smiley face won't stay upright. I ordered three packages and did keep one for the guys who wear dress shirts, but had to send the other two packages back.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for two bags. These pellets are the only thing (besides seeds) that my cockatiels will eat. It’s much healthier than just an all seed diet, I usually feed about 75% pellets and 25%seed. And of course veggies and fruit. But the bags were nice and sealed and smelled good. Will but again When i run out
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent bird food, this 2lb package is seriously overpriced!! I did not realize when I purchased it. Be aware, there are other sellers asking a fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quaker parrot loves them
customer_reviews.text: My Quaker parrot loves this food as a primary, but I throw in an assorted mix of nuts and other things as well and a couple treats. Seems to be the perfect size for him, and doesn't seem to end up in any large mess like the bigger pellets.
customer_reviews.author: StevenlAFl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 22 year old quaker
customer_reviews.text: My Quaker has been on zupreem for 19 years. This is her favorite mix. Nutrition so good your female's will sometimes pop out eggs lol she's 22 and going strong! For some reason she goes through periods where she ignores one specific color..... but usually she swings between friend and foe with the bananas.
customer_reviews.author: Tsilt

customer_reviews.title: Bananas
customer_reviews.text: For years my conure and quaker have both left the bananas for last. More so my conure but both of them consistently. The last two bags I received were way over represented with bananas. They must really be bad because both birds have avoided them totally. Their dishes are 100% uneaten bananas. And they are hungry. Enough with the bananas!
customer_reviews.author: Del Amrap

customer_reviews.title: I find that the medium/cockatiel sized pellets work better than the large/conure sized ones
customer_reviews.text: I find it tricky to review something I'm not eating myself, but I've fed this to my green cheek for about 5 years now and she's never had any apparent health issues, so I trust that the fortified pellet nutrition is doing its job. She does dump a lot of the yellow and orange pieces, but I'm willing to accept that as more of a personality thing than an issue with the product. She's green and red herself, after all. If you have a green cheek or other smaller conure, I find that the medium/cockatiel sized pellets work better than the large/conure sized ones. Smaller bites means less waste.
customer_reviews.author: TheFlyingDharma

customer_reviews.title: ZuPreem is the best food for your bird
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with ZuPreem. I have a very spoiled Eclectus Parrot and he loves this food. The next larger size is the correct size for him, but being spoiled, that size is too much work for him, so I buy this size pellet. Eclectus diet is fruit and vegetables, if you feed them seeds (even as a snack item) they will eat the seeds and ignore the fruit and veggies, then they don't get the nutrients they require. This is his primary food....ZuPreem makes several products for the varying needs of your bird.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Product is great as always. Good vendor
customer_reviews.text: My conure loves these. She drops them in her water cup. she likes eating them mushy Delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Looking at converting to pallets from birdseed I was suggested this brand by my veterinarian and when I went to my local pet store I was shocked at how much the bags were for 2 pounds in the store so this is definitely a great deal getting two bags for almost the price of one
customer_reviews.author: SpitFireKat

customer_reviews.title: Cockatiels Love It
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this food with three different cockatiels, and they all love it. These pellets are healthier for than than seeds, but the birds still seem to enjoy eating them. My one complaint is that when the birds eat them, they smash them up in their beaks and this creates a lot of dust and wasted product in the food bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Cockatiel loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel was raised on an all seed diet and had no trouble switching to these pellets. He would always eat the bananas first and i would find bananas thrown across my room from his messy eating lol. Lost a printer to a stray banana, but it’s okay
customer_reviews.author: S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and fruity
customer_reviews.text: When these are fresh, they're colorful and smell fruity. (For the uninitiated: color is to a parrot what sugar is to a human toddler.) I suspect the fruit smell is there mostly for us rather than for our birds, but I like to add a teaspoon of these to the Kaytee Forti Diet to give it color and variety. Over time, this blend does lose its color a bit, which makes it less appealing to my bird.
customer_reviews.author: Gadfly-in-Residence

customer_reviews.title: Great food for all sizes
customer_reviews.text: My birds absolutely love this food. I have 4 parakeets, 2 cockatiels, and a green cheek conure all in the same cage. I was buying the smaller food too, but the keets preferred the larger food.... No problem from me on that. No more waste when you switch to this food and happier birds.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Fodor

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong size - incorrectly labeled
customer_reviews.text: Although the bag was labeled as “medium” for medium birds, the actual feed was small or possibly even smaller if that’s a size. I’ve fed my parrot Medium for over 20 years and this definitely not medium. I had to open the bag before I discovered this so I didn’t even attempt a return. Just gave it to a friend with a smaller bird. Anyone else had problems with this seller?
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Scott Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Lilac Crowned Amazon thinks it's okay.  Soak them in water a new texture. Still transitioning!
customer_reviews.text: My Lilac Amazon is used to a diet of seeds, and frozen veggies (which we microwave for her); we want to transition to pellet based so we can always ensure she has a well rounded diet. The first time I gave her one, I acted like it was a "treat" and she ate it. But the next time I gave it to her, she just threw it on the ground as if I gave her dirt. She ate all her food except these pellets. Today, I tried soaking them in water; her eyes pinned and she seemed to like it more. Will continue to try to transition her to these; stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: LT in Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves the different colors
customer_reviews.text: My bird is 9 years old and I had been feeding him the same pallet all his life and suddenly he quit eating when I had bought a new package so I don't know if they've changed the formula or something but suddenly he was not interested so I decided to try zupreem because I noticed he was picking out the colored pellets that are in his seed. So I figured with all the colors that are in zupreem he would be interested and I was right he's eating them again!
customer_reviews.author: Fergie64

customer_reviews.title: Happy Cockatiels🌺
customer_reviews.text: Cinco 13 and Pookie 30 have eaten zupreem for there entire lives. I mix it with the plain and also feed cilantro and parsley with grated carrots and apple. Both birds I raised from eggs with the help of Mom ( Mamie)and Pop (Spot).😊
customer_reviews.author: Linda Neely

customer_reviews.title: green cheek conure loves it
customer_reviews.text: My green cheek conure eats this every day. The breeder I got her from was feeding this and the avian vet said it's fine to keep feeding her this. I also give her veggies and seeds for treats. I've had the bag for over 2 months and it looks like it will last at least another month. I purchased in February and the bag I got expires in July. Don't buy a bigger bag than this if you only have one bird.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A. Koch

customer_reviews.title: My birds like it.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well packaged and in good condition. Green cheek conure and African ring neck like this stuff. It smells kind of fruity. I mix it in with some other food for variety but this one seems to be favored over the plain pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: My green cheek conure loves them
customer_reviews.text: He goes crazy when I refill his bowl, even if there are pellets left in it. He eats everything but the bananas first, then if I don't refill his bowl he will eventually eat the bananas or drop them on the bottom of the cage. That is to be expected from a parrot though! Great value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Colorful - packaged well
customer_reviews.text: Trying to give my cockateil at least some pellets; so am mixing half seed & half pellets at this time; and she's still not sure - but, she's a very picky eater - doesn't like apple pieces, lettuce, cucumber, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Casad

customer_reviews.title: His favorite
customer_reviews.text: This was the first food we ever bought for him years ago.... he also ate seeds when my mom used to care for him... when he first got this food he would eat everything BUT the bananas lol now he eats them all and pretty much turns his nose up at regular seed
customer_reviews.author: D Mccraw

customer_reviews.title: This is a good size for parakeets
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised for small conures. I have a lessor black-winged jardine parrot. This is too small, and unfortunately, I bought a large bag, so it's going to last a long time. If you have a conure, even a small one, or anything larger than a budgie, for example, do not get this size, get the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Daine

customer_reviews.title: My conures love it
customer_reviews.text: My vet tells me that conures should be fed pellets along with a variety of fruits and veggies and grains. My 2 conures love these pellets. I wish they would eat the natural colored ones instead but they are fussy and apparently like the color variety in these.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaDawn

customer_reviews.title: These Bananananananas - Sun Conure Crack!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand of food we feed our Sun Conure and two Budgies. We free feed them both their designated essential mix all day and we give them a bowl of their designated enrichening blend for an hour each day. I specify "designated" because we have to purchase two types having a medium sized parrot and two small birds.
customer_reviews.author: CaSandra A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Yummy time in bird land
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiels love this product. Even my bigger parrots get it as a treat. Depending on the season and the bird, sometimes they will eat just the yellow and green pellets and sometime they eat the orange and red ones. When I open a new bag and give all of the birds a tablespoon of food, all I hear is crunching. They love it. I give it as a treat
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: My Cockatiel's favorite snack
customer_reviews.text: This is my birds favorite snack. I fill his extra bowl with this as an extra vitamin, snack for him with his food. He Loves all the flavors but the yellow one. It is a great price
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Renner

customer_reviews.title: Shipped when damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Love the brand and my quaker loves the food. I received my two bags of food and one of the bags were busted open. The shipping box was not damaged therefore I think maybe it was put in the box that way. Sure was a hassle trying to pour all the food out of the box into a container.
customer_reviews.author: sharon60

customer_reviews.title: A must for every "parront"
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a must for our feathered friends. Every vet recommends a pelleted diet and Zupreem appears to be the best. Buy this for the health of your bird.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Received two 2 pound packages.
customer_reviews.text: My green cheek has been eating this food for a long time. I tried the due fee version and he refused to eat it. I received 2 2 lb packages. This is angriest value!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Baz

customer_reviews.title: A Pelleted Diet Typicslly Ensures Birdie's Goid Health
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves this. I have been feeding him a pelleted diet since age 1.5 to 2 years of age. He is now 16 and in good health. I researched his diet and a seed diet everyday was not recommended because it is similar to a person eating fast food everyday. Occasionally he does get a honey seed stick.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I literally received this one day after ordering (on a weekend)! so if you need food fast, this is the way to go. using this for now till i can wean my boy onto something healthier (the breeder feeds this) but the food defiantly seems leagues better then what pet stores are selling
customer_reviews.author: Soyu

customer_reviews.title: Cockatiels love this fruity flavor
customer_reviews.text: Cockatiels love this fruity flavor! One of their favorites that I have been purchasing for many years. Conures love it too! Very pleased with this item and am happy that I made the purchase. Received exactly as described. Is what the product description has written about the item. Would purchase this item again and would also recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Loves Reviews

customer_reviews.title: and means less food waste. I plan on purchasing this food for many ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my bird this mix for a few years. He cannot eat too many seeds, as he needs to avoid too much fat. This holds up to my needs. My bird likes this food, except for the bananas. It seems as though they've recently changed the banana shape in the newer packages, which has made my bird a little more apt to eat them, and means less food waste. I plan on purchasing this food for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Holly W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for my bird
customer_reviews.text: My bird loves this food and it arrives very quickly! It’s great for the price too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived quickly. My birds eat it...well what doesn't go on the floor that is. And its less expensive than going to the local pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Philpott

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps he doesn't like the red food coloring
customer_reviews.text: My conure likes these pellets, but he refuses to eat the red ones. Perhaps he doesn't like the red food coloring. I would prefer to feed him pellets that are not inundated with food coloring, but he refuses to eat the solid brown, all natural ones, also. I'm still searching for the perfect pellet.
customer_reviews.author: erby

customer_reviews.title: My birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: I know it's crazy but my cockatoo, and conures prefer the cockatiel size. Most birds are picky but immediately you can see a difference and as soon as I opened the bag a strong citrus scent. The larger size more appropriate for them is dark, a lot of crumbs and doesn't smell as good.A big and expensive waste. They all eat every bit, no waste☺️
customer_reviews.author: big pappa

customer_reviews.title: They love it and it is healthy for them
customer_reviews.text: My husband orders this food for his birds. They love it and it is healthy for them. The only thing I do not care for is they chew the food balls in half which shoots the other half out of the cage and all over the floor. If we don't sweep in the bird room for a couple of days it literally looks like it has been raining Trix.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best and only company to order Zupreem from!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only company I trust to send me the freshest two packs of Zupreem FruitBlend. I ordered from a different company once before and it only had the green balls and bananas in it. I trust Assav#$&+- 100%!!! Sorry I forgot the full spelling, lol. Bottom line my green cheek conures love their Zupreem!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCY

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem fruit blend for medium birds
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand of bird food. The pellets are a great source of well balanced minerals and food. The fruit extrusions are in different shapes. Cockatiels love to pick and they have active imaginations. I like the fruit blend as an addition to the natural flavor. I haven't decided which shape or color they like best. They do enjoy looking at it though and choosing what suits their mood best at the moment, I know that their avian needs are being well met with Zupreem.
customer_reviews.author: rmkuma

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My Fids are the pickiest eaters you will ever find. When I got them they had only been eating seeds their entire life’s. I have purchased other brands to try to get them to try pellets but nothing worked. I purchased this Zupreem brand and this is only day 2! They absolutely love it! So happy and definitely will continue to purchase more!
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: My Tiels Love This
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiels love this product. The little shaped nuggets almost smell like fruit loops. They love their seeds but they also love this. I give them a mixed diet of seeds and pellets (along with other greens, cereals and treats), and I mix the seeds and pellets together so they can get what they want. This product is expensive. However, I do buy it whenever I can. I believe a diet of good food can support your bird's health. This is the only pellet food I buy for my tiels because of its high quality.
customer_reviews.author: AutumnElf

customer_reviews.title: Usually a product such as this is fine. In this case
customer_reviews.text: Usually a product such as this is fine. In this case, the vacuum had been lost and product fragrance and probably its taste was missing. This product was likely stored in hot/cold enviornment for a long period. I threw it out and purchased a similar product from another vendor! I will continue to purchase this type product as my bird loves it, HOWEVER, I WILL NEVER PURCHASE FROM THIS PRODUCER AGAIN!!!! It's too expensive to throw out!
customer_reviews.author: LoregayB

customer_reviews.title: She likes them!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I have a fussy bird and I'm surprised she eats the fruit flavored pellets. I struggle to get her to eat normal flavored pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Tika

customer_reviews.title: Zupreem is a great product for birds
customer_reviews.text: Can't say I love it really, because I personally have not tried it. But my birds have been on it for a long time, and I would recommend it. I have a Senegal and an African Gray Timneh and they both prefer the smaller size pellets for the cockatiels. I mix a small amount of seed mix with it. My bird vet had suggested it several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Viv Miles

customer_reviews.title: Conure's best friend
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to change my conure's diet to pellets from seed. I tried Zupreem Fruit Blend and my Joie took to it right away. He loved it and he hasn't eaten any seed since. Pellets and fruits and vegetables, are a great diet. My bird is happy and healthy. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this food for my lovebirds for almost 5 years and before that, I bought it for my cockatiels - so that should tell you something! This stuff is great and my birds have always loved it (although my lovebirds pick out all the bananas!). I'm sure I'll continue to purchase this food for many years to come :)
customer_reviews.author: Areliana

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves the bananas! :I
customer_reviews.text: I wish everyone would send me the bananas cause my bird loves them the most than any of them. I have more colored ones than bananas at the end of the day. But overall, he eats them as a last case scenario.
customer_reviews.author: Luis M.

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel likes the yellow moon shaped bits
customer_reviews.text: The bigger round bits are a little difficult for him to beak, but he likes the flavor. He seems to prefer the parakeet sized pellets.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown.usr

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel is happy.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased and my cockatiel Fluffy is pleased too. I used to order from a local pet store when I had more birds, it was a very big bag, so this is the first time I bought on amazon. The pellets are a bit smaller than before, although for the same size of birds, it seems even better. It took a couple of days for Fluffy to get used to them, it is all good.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Kossak

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the bird "size"
customer_reviews.text: My ringneck will not eat this, which is disappointing! But my lovebird really likes it. I think "medium" is still on the small side. Smaller parrots who like to hold food they eat cannot do that with these pellets, but littler birds who just eat with their beaks seem to really like it. I like the ingredient list and natural ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly worth it definitely buy
customer_reviews.text: Yoshi( normal green cheeked conure) hated pellets he always threw them into his water and never ate them until I bought these, now he gets these pellets almost every week, he gets 1 or 2 days of regular conure food but mainly pellets
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my bird fed
customer_reviews.text: My bird has been eating this food for years. It lasts me forever (seeing as I only have one small bird) and he really seems to enjoy it. He isn't too fond of the banana shapes but he will eat them and it seems to be a matter of personal preference. Will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie K.

customer_reviews.title: Pellets are not the same as before
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this item several times from this seller with no issues but this time I was sent a different product. It could’ve been a change by the manufacturer but the normal size food is now smaller and my large bird has issues eating such small pellets
customer_reviews.author: Michaela C. Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My conure is a very picky Waterbury had zero problems taking to this. Was very fresh and we'll packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used for years but need to give very little due to high sugar content and mixed with zupreem pellets and regular seeds in a 1/2/2 ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great bird food
customer_reviews.text: Great bird food. My bird is an 18 year old cockatiel and I have been feeding her this food for 10 of those years. She still has the energy of a young bird and I think it has to do with a good diet. She also gets plenty of fresh food but this is a great daily diet.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: The one thing Jaws wouldn't bite
customer_reviews.text: My Cockatiel absolutely hated this. I'm sure it's a great product, but I can't confirm since he absolutely would not touch it. I even tried mixing his favorite treat with it, but he refused to even go into his feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiels love love this feed!
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiels love love this feed! They will eat the yellow banana out of an entire dish first before moving on to another color or flavor, and amazing they are so nimble to sort what they eat. I ran out of this feed a while back and had to use the grocery store pet seed Katee variety and it threw them both into a molt and they wasted most of it. That type of feed is not good for your birds and their health. Keep them on this ZuPreem diet for optimum health and happy birds!
customer_reviews.author: PasoCreek

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The price is great and my cockatiel loves this food. My only problem is that it has lots of artificial dyes in it, which make me a little nervous to feed this to her in the long run. It’s good food for getting her used to pellets and will help with switching her to natural pellets at some point.
customer_reviews.author: snow.mantis

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my conjure he loves it. Supreme is recommended by our avarian vet
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: My parrot must think I'm mad at him...
customer_reviews.text: After reading the positive reviews, I decided to try this food for my Senegal parrot. What a disappointment. He hates this stuff, doesn't even recognize it as food and throws it out of his dish without eating it. He loves Lafaeber's food, especially the Nutriberries (I call it birdy crack). Fortunately, I have chickens that will eat this, so at least it won't go to waste! Mighty expensive for chicky food, so I definitely will not be buying this again. Shipping was good, and the box was well packed. Always get the freshest products for my pets when I buy from Amazon, and the prices are much lower than the local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Paula S. Hertel

customer_reviews.title: They love the color/flavor of the food
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 lovebirds who have been strictly on this diet for almost 10 years, after an aviary veterinarian suggested I start to feed my two original lovebirds this food. They love the color/flavor of the food, and if their ongoing health is any indication of the quality of the food, I would say that it is doing them wonders!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel likes it
customer_reviews.text: my 8 month cockatiel like this, he is a very picky bird with food, only liked dry food. i trust this product because offers all kinds of vitamins,
customer_reviews.author: Luz C

customer_reviews.title: Expensive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it's what the breeder was feeding them. Cheaper here than pet store but still way too expensive for such small bags.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased medium for a cockatiel. So far he loves it. I’ve had him on it for about a week and it seems like he has much more energy and is much more active than on seed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: He seems to like them a lot
customer_reviews.text: Just got these for my cockatiel. The minute I brought the bag out he was curious, and it didn't take much effort to convince him to try some. He seems to like them a lot, as evidenced by how quickly he gobbled up the little bit I gave him to taste. I think we have a new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: My Mallee Ringneck Parrot Likes Most of Them
customer_reviews.text: Well, I don't love these pellets but my parrot does... for the most part. Mango is a cherry-picker (like most parrots) and given any choice, he'll only eat those seeds and pellets that he feels like eating. Everything else gets tossed on the floor. So, Mango likes the yellow and red pellets but the green ones go for a sail. Friends and family are always looking at the floor as they crunch one of the green pellets under their feet. But if you can't get your parrot to eat Harrison's or Roudybush, these pellet are a good alternative
customer_reviews.author: chilewillow

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves it
customer_reviews.text: I heard this was a healthier alternative to feeding your bird JUST seed, which you're not supposed to do. Your birdie needs a healthy diet of fruits and veggies too but my bird doesn't like fresh veggies it seems. This is a great alternative and a great bird food all around. Did my research on this one. Good product for a healthy pet.
customer_reviews.author: LavoneMoltron

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Only healthy food my cockatiel will eat. (Just the red pellets though)
customer_reviews.author: h gray

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for seven years with my yellow nape Amazon. I recommend this along with fresh fruits and veggies,and a well balanced seed mix. The color of his feathers are always super bright and shiny. The best part is, he LOVES it!! I know some people may back away from this product due to the price but we can’t put a price tag when it comes to keeping our babies healthy,
customer_reviews.author: Kim Matteo

customer_reviews.title: First thing he eats!
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Harrisons pellets, as he grew bored with them despite them making him profoundly healthy ( he was a rescue), but he was throwing them around his cage. The moment I put these fruity smelling, colorful and inviting pellets into his bowl...he was hooked. No more messes and wasted food.
customer_reviews.author: Jules Do-good

customer_reviews.title: Favorite food
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves this food. Tends to not eat the red ones...not sure why, but enjoys the rest. Shipped quick.
customer_reviews.author: jnzdogs

customer_reviews.title: My birds like them
customer_reviews.text: I made to rate flavor and freshness.. that’s a guess but my three birds like these!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Larson

customer_reviews.title: Best pellets for switching seed eaters
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel immediately started eating this from a seed diet. I couldn't believe it. I tried Harrison's but they have no flavor and made it a hard sell to my birdies. My conure ate it from my hand too though she's picky when it's all in her bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Arisaidthat

customer_reviews.title: Pellets That Birds Actually Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I swear by this product. My birds will eat this before the seeds when I mix them their bird food.
customer_reviews.author: Trieste 54

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the pellets weren't too big for my cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if the pellets weren't too big for my cockatiel. He doesn't like the big seeds or pellets. I ordered the same product for parakeets, I am sure he will eat those since they should be smaller. If you don't have a bird who is picky about the size of the pellets, it would be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

product_meta.title: ZuPreem FruitBlend Flavor Pellets Bird Food for Medium Birds | Powerful Pellets Made in USA, Naturally Flavored for Cockatiels, Quakers, Lovebirds, Small Conures
product_meta.description: Size:2 lb bag (2-pack)ZuPreem FruitBlend Flavor Pellets Bird Food for Medium Birds, 2 lb bag (2-pack) | Powerful Pellets Made in the USA, Naturally Flavored for Cockatiels, Quakers, Lovebirds, Small Conures
feature_bullets: Made in the USA specifically for Cockatiels, Quakers, Lovebirds and small Conures with real whole grains from North America’s Heartland.
HEALTHY and DELICIOUS. Provides essential nutrition for a healthy and balanced diet.
Fruit colors, shapes and Natural Flavors with the Essential Nutrients your bird needs every day for good health.
ESSENTIAL NUTRITION. Fortified with essential vitamins, minerals, and amino acids. Feed daily to provide the foundation of your bird’s diet.
Convert Your Bird to a Healthier Diet. Converting your bird to a food that includes pellets is worth the effort for his/her health and wellbeing.
